oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry Network Broadcast - 1957-03-09
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording is of the Grand Ole Opry radio show on March 9, 1957. The tape features performers like: Hank Snow, Porter Wagoner, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, David "Stringbean" Akeman, and Minnie Pearl. This tape is thirty-two of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Jordanaires; Porter Wagoner; Grant Turner; Chet Atkins; Minnie Pearl;David "Stringbean" Akeman;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Grant Turner begins the show -- (00:14) Calypso Sweetheart (Hank Snow) -- (02:33) Hank Snow welcomes everyone and previews the show's line up -- (03:09) Sugaree (The Jordanaires) -- (05:24) Snow introduces Porter Wagoner -- (06:03) Satisfied Mind (Porter Wagoner) -- (08:07) Prince Albert (P.A.) tobacco commercial with Grant Turner and Hank Snow -- (09:13) Square dancing -- (10:27) Snow introduces next song -- (10:43) God's Little Candles [Child's prayer spoken by Hank Snow] (Hank Snow) -- (13:10) Snow introduces Chet Atkins -- (13:29) Tennessee Blues (Chet Atkins) -- (15:31) Snow introduces Minnie Pearl -- (15:50) Minnie Pearl skit -- (19:16) P.A. tobacco commercial with Hank Snow and Minnie Pearl -- (20:27) Snow reintroduces Porter Wagoner -- (20:50) I'm Day Dreamin' Tonight (Porter Wagoner) -- (23:07) Snow introduces String Bean -- (23:17) John Henry (David "Stringbean" Akeman) -- (25:21) Marriage and Divorce (Hank Snow) -- (27:54) Snow previews next week's show and says good bye -- (28:34) Camel cigarette commercial -- (29:30) Beginning of WSM Nashville
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Wagoner, Porter; Atkins, Chet; Minnie Pearl; Turner, Grant; Jordanaires (Musical group); Stringbean, 1915-1973;
